import React from "react"; import styled from "styled-components/macro"; import { NavLink } from "react-router-dom"; import { Helmet } from "react-helmet"; import { CardContent, ClickAwayListener, Fab, Fade, Grid, Link, Breadcrumbs as MuiBreadcrumbs, Button as MuiButton, Card as MuiCard, Divider as MuiDivider, IconButton as MuiIconButton, Paper as MuiPaper, Tooltip, Typography, Zoom, } from "@material-ui/core"; import { Add as AddIcon, Delete as DeleteIcon } from "@material-ui/icons"; import { spacing } from "@material-ui/system"; const Card = styled(MuiCard)(spacing); const Divider = styled(MuiDivider)(spacing); const Breadcrumbs = styled(MuiBreadcrumbs)(spacing); const Paper = styled(MuiPaper)(spacing); const IconButton = styled(MuiIconButton)(spacing); const Button = styled(MuiButton)(spacing); function SimpleTooltips() { return ( Simple Tooltips Tooltips display informative text when users hover over, focus on, or tap an element. ); } function PositionedTooltips() { return ( Positioned Tooltips The Tooltip has 12 placements choice. They don’t have directional arrows; instead, they rely on motion emanating from the source to convey direction.

); } function TriggersTooltips() { const [open, setOpen] = React.useState(false); const handleTooltipClose = () => { setOpen(false); }; const handleTooltipOpen = () => { setOpen(true); }; return ( Triggerable Tooltips You can define the types of events that cause a tooltip to show.
); } function TransitionsTooltips() { return ( Simple Tooltips Tooltips display informative text when users hover over, focus on, or tap an element. ); } function Tooltips() { return ( Tooltips Dashboard Components Tooltips ); } export default Tooltips;
